description: As the war in Ukraine drags on, the U.S. military is keeping a close eye on how drones are changing the conflict. They are used by both Russia and Ukraine to watch troop movements, identify targets and drop bombs. We go to the woods of Louisiana to see what lessons the U.S. Army is incorporating into its training and understand what it might mean for future wars.
title: What the U.S. Military is Learning from the Drone War in Ukraine

description: The House of Representatives approved legislation funding federal agencies through December 20. The vote comes days ahead of a September 30 deadline to avoid a shutdown.
title: House approves funding bill to avoid government shutdown

description: The Taliban have been targeting thousands of Afghan National Army soldiers and police officers, accusing them of being American spies.
title: Three years after the U.S. withdrawal, former Afghan forces are hunted by the Taliban

description: For Palestinians in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, access to water has been a struggle for years. But since last Oct. 7, water has become even harder for them to obtain.
title: In the occupied West Bank, Palestinians struggle to access water

description: People with disabilities, people who can't afford it and people who don't want to abandon their pets are among the many who can't easily get up and leave before a hurricane.
title: Some don't evacuate despite repeated hurricane warnings — because they can't

description: It is the world's largest displacement crisis: 13 million people have fled their homes in war-torn Sudan. In neighboring Chad, both refugees and locals cope with this extraordinary upheaval.
title: Sudanese refugees fled to Chad with hope. What they found is a bitter irony

description: Nursing aides feel abandoned as they grapple with mental and physical troubles that stem from their work during the COVID outbreak.
title: Nursing aides plagued by PTSD after ‘nightmare’ COVID conditions, with little help

description: With the presidential election considered a toss up, the votes that third-party and independent candidates receive in key states could decide the White House. Here's who's on those state ballots.
title: Here's who's on ballots in the 7 states likely to decide the presidential election

description: Shady Rest Country Club in Scotch Plains, N.J., was established in 1921. The sports and entertainment venue is being renovated, with help from a special historic preservation program.
title: The nation's first Black country club gets more than love in its coffers

description: Helene is forecast to intensify rapidly over the Gulf of Mexico before making landfall in Florida on Thursday. Residents are urged to make preparations — and in many counties, evacuate — before then.
title: Tropical Storm Helene is forecast to become a major hurricane as it nears Florida

description: Missouri executed Marcellus Williams yesterday, a man prosecutors believed was innocent. And, why FAFSA’s launch was so disastrous.
title: Missouri executes man prosecutors thought innocent. And, FAFSA’s disastrous launch

description: Nintendo's latest game is the first to truly star Zelda in the series that has borne her name since 1986. It boasts innovative mechanics but is still a little too linked to the past.
title: 'Echoes of Wisdom' review: Zelda leads a worthwhile remix, not a revolution

description: Vice President Harris is trying to win over undecided voters in key swing states like Pennsylvania. Former President Donald Trump also talked about manufacturing policy on Tuesday in Georgia.
title: Harris heads to Pittsburgh (again) to make a manufacturing pitch to voters

description: Extensive early warnings and years of adaptation made the floods less deadly than they otherwise might have been.
title: Europe's intense rainfall in September twice as likely thanks to climate change

description: The song "Monkeys Spinning Monkeys" was released ten years ago and has since become the soundtrack to millions of viral videos. Its story shows how music has shaped — and been shaped by— social media platforms.
title: How a catchy tune became the soundtrack to TikTok's silliest videos

description: As part of NPR’s "We, The Voters" series — we went to Nevada to talk to residents about their housing situation, the state’s affordable housing crisis and what factors are driving it.
title: Why Nevada's housing crisis is about more than Californians driving up home prices

description: New technology is making it easier to find the origins of trafficked wildlife so they can be released back to the habitat they came from, instead of languishing for decades as sometimes happens.
title: The slowest of trailblazers: Better DNA testing means trafficked turtles can go home

description: As the battle between Israel and Hezbollah intensifies, western nations aim to prevent the conflict from spiraling into a broader regional war –- one that could draw in Iran, Hezbollah’s key backer.
title: Iran remains on the sidelines as the Israel-Hezbollah fight intensifies

description: Charges brought by private citizens are rare, but not unheard of, in Ohio. State law requires a hearing to take place before the affidavit can move forward.
title: Haitian group seeks charges against Trump and Vance over false Springfield claims
